comment: He is an old-school classic professor, plain and simple. That means papers, exams of varying difficulty, and pop quizzes. The pop qs aren't too hard assuming you paid attention the days before. The exams aren't too hard and most if not all of the questions come from his power points. A good grade is more than possible in his class.

He also responds quickly to emails and gives feedback. I'd take it again.

comment: Professor Bronstein teaches off powerpoints you follow in class it's hard to keep up sometimes because he goes fast but you are allowed to record for your own use. The 4 tests are easy if you study and read the book. There are also 5 pop quizzes (not actually pop quizzes) and two artifact papers to write but not too tedious overall.

Overall I wouldn't recommend taking this class unless you absolutely have to. If you missed class, you missed notes because they are only partially filled out when published. Also, lectures moved really fast so it was close to impossible to get it all. The only good thing I can say about this class is the professor is good about answering emails.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy
